main event: A bright light was observed in the sky by multiple witnesses in February 1965, which was later concluded to be the ECHO I satellite.
interesting points: The object was visible for about 2 1/4 minutes and appeared dimmer than the brightest star., The object faded out gradually instead of disappearing instantly., It was observed to have a chrome metallic color., Witnesses reported that the object emitted no sound and left no trail., It travelled easterly through the constellations Cassiopeia and Gemini.
sighted object: A bright, oval-shaped light in the sky
witness description: The sighting involved two witnesses who saw the object hovering and pulsating; there is mention of at least one other report during this period.
